ref: 10496 *yuṭati ʻ is joined ʼ. 2. *yuṭyati. 3. *yuṭṭa -- . 4. *yōṭayati (yaúṭati, yaúḍati ʻ joins ʼ Dhātup.). 5. *yōṭa -- (yōṭaka -- m. ʻ constellation ʼ lex.). [juṭati, juḍati ʻ binds ʼ Dhātup. are MIA. (S. with j -- attests earlier y -- ). Relationship with √yu1 or √yuj is obscure. Direct derivation (P. Tedesco OrLit 1932 col. 530) of *juḍa -- < yuta -- or *juṭṭa -- < yuktá -- is phonet. difficult. Poss. the series started with MIA. *yuṭṭa<-> which replaced yutta -- and from which *yuṭati, *yōṭayati, &c. were analogically created (cf. truṭyati). Forms in H. M. with -- ḷ -- and -- l -- (< earlier -- ḍ -- or -- l -- ) suggest non -- Aryan origin or influence, or may be due to collision with yugala -- . -- √*yuṭ]
S. juṛaṇu ʻ to fit, be prepared, be built ʼ;
L. juṛaṇ ʻ to be joined ʼ;
P. juṛnā ʻ to be joined, be mended, be gained ʼ;
cur. juṛṇā ʻ to be obtained ʼ, (Joshi) juṛnu ʻ to meet in battle ʼ;
cur. juṛṇā ʻ to be obtained ʼ, (Joshi) juṛnu ʻ to meet in battle ʼ;
N. jurnu ʻ to be forthcoming ʼ, jur -- mil ʻ putting together bride's and groom's horoscopes ʼ;
B. juṛā ʻ to be fastened, meet, happen ʼ; O
Aw. juraï intr. ʻ assembles, meets ʼ;
H. juṛnā ʻ to be joined, copulate, come to hand ʼ, julnā ʻ to be united, agree ʼ; O
Marw. juḍaï ʻ to be fastened ʼ; O
G. juḍaï intr. ʻ unites, is fitting ʼ;
M. j̈uḍṇẽ ʻ to come together ʼ, j̈uḷṇẽ ʻ to put together, make meet ʼ, j̈ūḷ f. ʻ tying (two animals) together ʼ (or < yugala -- ?). -- See *saṁyuṭati.
